column4: does anybody know if u can burn (copy) a dvd using a dvd+r disc?
A video DVD, or another dvd+r you burned?
i want to copy a dvd using dvd+r
a dvd thati bought form the store
You can, it depends what the DVD is. If it's video, or a recent game... it might be bigger than 4GB, which means it might not fit on your DVD+R unless it's dual layer

If it's a video, there are some utilities to rip the video and then encode it in a poorer quality so it will fit on a burnable single-layer DVD. If it's a game, there's not much you can do but put it on two disks
i have a dvd+r(16x)disc and i am trying to make a copy of a dvd
yes I undertand. Your dvd+r 16x disk is probably -not- big enough to hold the information on the DVD you bought.
ok how do  i rip the dvd onto my computer?
i tried dvd:rip but i dono whats wrong
Hrm. dvd::rip is what I would have suggested. I've only used it once though, I'm not very experienced :(
oh rats! well do you know anybody here that is familiar with dvd:rip
i am just trying to rip a movie thats all
sorry nope I don't visit here enough :( Is dvdrip giving you an error?
no i just do not know how to rip a movie
where can i find acid dvd rip?
